name: at
description: Schedules a command to run once at a specified future time. Takes a time specification (e.g. 'now + 5 minutes', '4:00 PM', 'midnight', 'noon tomorrow', '2pm Jan 15') and reads commands from stdin. The commands execute in a copy of the current environment. Use atq to list pending jobs and atrm to remove them. Unlike cron, at is for one-time deferred execution, not recurring schedules. Common use: schedule a reminder, delay a backup until off-peak hours, or queue a deployment for a maintenance window.

input.description: A time specification as the argument, and one or more shell commands on stdin. Time formats include: HH:MM, midnight, noon, teatime (4pm), now + N minutes/hours/days, or a date like 'Jan 15 2pm'.

output.description: Confirmation of the scheduled job with a job number and execution time. The scheduled command's stdout/stderr is mailed to the user when it runs.

examples.description: Schedule a backup to run in 2 hours

examples.input: echo 'echo reminder: standup' | at 9:00 AM tomorrow
